title: Love Island's Arabella Chi turns heads in a plunging white tank top and PVC trousers
text:
On Saturday, she gushed with pride over her boyfriend Wes Nelson's Celebrity X Factor performance.

And Arabella Chi dazzled during a solo outing at Nature Republic's first UK launch on Charing Cross Road in London on Tuesday.

The former Love Islander, 28, stepped out in a striking pair of black leather trousers before sampling the luxurious beauty products on offer at the Korean makeup brand's event.

Stunning: Arabella Chi, 28, dazzled during a solo outing at Korean makeup brand Nature Republic's launch in London on Tuesday

Arabella was the picture of sophistication as she posed up a storm in tight leather trousers that she paired with a loose fitting white shirt which showed off her bronzed cleavage.

A thigh-length black coat shielded the reality star from a chilly autumnal breeze outside the store - moments before she headed inside to test the 'eco friendly' products.

Her long blonde hair was styled straight and she wore a simple makeup look - keeping it minimal with a splash of foundation and a nude lipstick.

She accessorised the ensemble with a black baguette bag which she wore across her chest and accentuated her long legs with a slight heel on black ankle boots with a pointed toe.

Turning heads: Arabella ensured all eyes would be on her as she posed for snaps at the event

Beauty: The former Love Islander stepped out in a striking pair of black leather trousers before sampling the luxurious beauty products on offer at the store

Stylish: Arabella was the picture of sophistication as she posed up a storm in tight leather trousers paired with a loose fitting white shirt which showed off her bronzed cleavage

It comes after she revealed she is 'proud' of her boyfriend Wes Nelson after his successful first audition on The X Factor: Celebrity.

Wes is part of the group The Islanders on the show with his fellow Love Island stars Samira Mighty, Zara McDermott and Eyal Booker.

Arabella, who competed on this year's series of the reality show, said she was thrilled for her significant other and hopes to be in the audience at the live shows after Wes, 21, got through on Monday.

Keeping warm: A thigh-length black coat shielded the reality star from a chilly autumnal breeze outside the store - moments before she headed inside to test the 'eco friendly' products

Speaking exclusively to MailOnline at the Elbrook Cash and Carry Charity Gala Dinner at CHAK 89 in Surrey on Thursday, Arabella said: 'I knew that he could rap but I loved everyone’s reaction. He’s really good.

'Obviously I had heard him sing, he sings all the time at home. I was proud of him. It’s definitely a passion of his. If he gets to the live shows [I'll be there], for sure.'

Wes and his fellow islanders sang Shawn Mendes' There's Nothing Holding Me Back for their audition in front of the judges, with Wes adding in a rap.

Arabella and Wes made their romance official in August when they both shared an identical snap of themselves looking cosy at the Palm Beach Casino.

Fame: Arabella and Wes made their romance official in August when they both shared an identical snap of themselves looking cosy at the Palm Beach Casino

While they are living their relationship in the glare of the public eye, Arabella said the attention has not been difficult.

'It hasn’t been difficult at all. From day one, we’ve made it the most normal relationship,' she said.

'We’ve never been like: "Oh, we’re having a relationship in the public eye. We just try to forget that. We’re not like: "You can’t do this, you can’t do that."

'We’re just two normal people who like each other. We just do things like how you would in any relationship and that’s what’s made us really strong.'

Contender: Wes is part of the group The Islanders on the show with his fellow Love Island stars Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty and Zara McDermott (pictured in October 2019)

Arabella spent a week in the Love Island villa and had a short-lived romance with Danny Williams.

The model admitted it was 'surreal' when she finally got her phone back after leaving the villa and saw the huge increase in social media followers she had.

'It was a really nice break to not have it,' she said. 'My phone has been my work for like 10 years and you always need to have it by you so it was quite nice not to have it.'
description: The former Love Islander, 28, dazzled during a solo outing at Nature Republic's first UK launch on Charing Cross Road in London on Tuesday.
